html: As at Israel’s ancient Passover ( Exodus 12), Jehovah’s covenant people are to “hide” in their habitations until hiswrath is past—until the king of Assyria/Babylon’s work of punishing the wicked blows over and he is punished himself. While Jehovah intervenes to protect his elect who participate in a new exodus to Zion ( Isaiah 43:2, 5-6, 48:20-21 #three_col"> Isaiah 43:2, 5-6, 48:20-21-Isaiah 43:2, 5-6, 16-48:20-21; 48:20-21; 52:11-12; 48:20-21; 52:11-12- Isaiah 43:2, 5-6, 16-48:20-21; 48:20-21; 52:11-12; 48:20-21; 52:11-12), he protects only indirectly those who don’t prove loyal under all conditions and thus don’t qualify for the new exodus. On resurrection morning—at Jehovah’s coming to reign—the earth’s slain, too, awake to a glorious new age ( v 19).
